Fill in the blanks : 
(i) Two triangles having the same shape but not necessarily the same size are called .................

(i) All Congruent figures are similar.

(iii) In a circle, sector and segment are equal.

(v) The tangents drawn at the ends of a diameter of a circle are parallel.

(vi) The empirical relationship between the three measures of central tendency is “3 median = mode + 2 mean”.

(iv) Write the coordinates of the origin.

questions.answer: A line that intersects the circle at two distinct points.

questions.question:
Answer in one sentence/word : 
(vi) Write one example of pair of similar figures.
Find the LCM of the numbers 12, 15 and 21 by the prime factorization method.
Express 140 as a product of its prime factors.
Find the sum of first 10 terms of an A.P. : 2, 7, 12, ...
Find the number of terms in the A.P. : 7, 13, 19, ..., 205.
Find the zeroes of the quadratic polynomial x² + 7x + 10.
Find a quadratic polynomial the sum and product of whose zeroes are 5 and 7 respectively.
questions.explanation: Polynomial is given by x² - (sum of zeroes)x + (product of zeroes). Here sum=5, product=7. So, x² - 5x + 7.

questions.question: An arc of a circle of radius 21 cm subtends an angle of 60° at the centre. Find the length of the arc.
A chord of a circle of radius 10 cm subtends right angle at the centre. Find the area of corresponding sector.
Solve the pair of linear equations x + y = 14 and x - y = 4.
questions.explanation: Adding equations: 2x = 18 => x=9. Substitute in first: 9+y=14 => y=5.

questions.question: On Comparing the ratios a₁/a₂, b₁/b₂ and c₁/c₂, find out whether the pair of linear equations 3x+2y=5 and 2x-3y=7 are consist or Inconsistent.
questions.explanation: Equations: 3x+2y-5=0 and 2x-3y-7=0. a₁/a₂ = 3/2. b₁/b₂ = 2/-3. Since a₁/a₂ ≠ b₁/b₂, the lines intersect at a unique point, so they are Consistent.

questions.question: Write next two terms of A.P. : 4, 9, 14, 19,...
Write the first term and common difference of the A.P. 3, 15, 27, 39,...
questions.explanation: First term a = 3. Common difference d = 15 - 3 = 12.

questions.question: Write the conditions for the similarity of two triangles.
questions.answer: 1. Their corresponding angles are equal. 2. Their corresponding sides are in the same ratio (proportional).

questions.question: Write the statement of Basic Proportionality Theorem.
questions.answer: If a line is drawn parallel to one side of a triangle to intersect the other two sides in distinct points, the other two sides are divided in the same ratio.

questions.question: Find the distance between points (2,-5) and (-2, 9).
Find the coordinates of the point which divides the line segment joining the points (-1, 7) and (4,-3) in the ratio 2:3.
If sin A = 3/5, then find the value of cos A and tan A.
questions.explanation: Opposite=3, Hypotenuse=5. Adjacent = √(5²-3²) = 4. cos A = Adj/Hyp = 4/5. tan A = Opp/Adj = 3/4.

questions.question: Find the value of 2tan30° / (1 + tan²30°).
The length of a tangent from a point A at distance 5 cm from the centre of the circle is 4 cm. Find the radius of the circle.
questions.explanation: Let radius be r. Distance d=5, tangent l=4. In right triangle, r² + l² = d². r² + 4² = 5². r² = 25 - 16 = 9. r = 3.

questions.question: Two concentric circles are of radii 5 cm and 3 cm. Find the length of the chord of the larger circle which touches the smaller circle.
questions.explanation: The chord is tangent to the smaller circle. Half length = √(R² - r²) = √(5² - 3²) = √(25-9) = √16 = 4. Total length = 2 * 4 = 8 cm.

questions.question: If P(E) = 0.05, what is the probability of 'not E'?
Find the Probability of getting a head, when a coin is tossed once.
questions.explanation: Possible outcomes: H, T. Favorable: H. Probability = 1/2.

questions.question: A card is drawn from a well shuffled deck of 52 cards. Find the probability of getting a king.
questions.explanation: Total cards = 52. Number of Kings = 4. Probability = 4/52 = 1/13.

questions.question: A bag contains 3 red, 2 white and 5 black balls. A ball is drawn at random from this bag. Find the probability that it is red.
Find the nature of the roots of quadratic equation 2x² - 6x + 3 = 0.
questions.explanation: Discriminant D = b² - 4ac = (-6)² - 4(2)(3) = 36 - 24 = 12. Since D > 0, roots are real and distinct.

questions.question: Find the roots of the quadratic equation 2x² + x - 6 = 0.

A tower stands vertically on the ground. From a point on the ground, which is 15m away from the foot of the tower, the angle of elevation of the top of the tower is found to be 60°. Find the height of the tower.
questions.explanation: tan 60° = Height / Distance. √3 = h / 15. h = 15√3 m.

questions.question: The angle of elevation of the top of a tower from a point on the ground, which is 30m away from the foot of the tower, is 30°. Find the height of the tower.
Prove that 3 + 2√5 is an irrational number.
questions.answer: Proof steps involve assuming it is rational, isolating √5, and showing contradiction.

questions.question: Given HCF (306, 657) = 9. Find the LCM (306, 657).
questions.explanation: LCM × HCF = Product of numbers. LCM = (306 × 657) / 9 = 34 × 657 = 22338.

questions.question: Five years ago, Nuri was thrice as old as Sonu. Ten years later, Nuri will be twice as old as Sonu. How old are Nuri and Sonu.
The difference between two numbers is 26 and one number is three times the other. Find the numbers.

A vessel is in the shape of a hollow hemisphere on which a hollow cylinder is mounted. The diameter of the hemisphere is 14 cm and the total height of the vessel is 13 cm. Find the internal surface area of the vessel.
questions.explanation: Radius r = 7. Height of cylinder h = 13 - 7 = 6. Area = CSA Hemisphere + CSA Cylinder = 2πr² + 2πrh = 2πr(r+h) = 2(22/7)(7)(7+6) = 44(13) = 572.

questions.question: Two Cubes each of volume 64 cm³ are joined end to end. Find the surface area of the resulting cuboid.
questions.explanation: Volume a³ = 64 => a = 4. Joined cuboid dimensions: Length=8, Width=4, Height=4. SA = 2(lb+bh+hl) = 2(32+16+32) = 2(80) = 160.

questions.question:
The following table gives the literacy rate (in percentage) of 35 cities.
Literacy Rate (in %) 45 - 55 55 - 65 65 - 75 75 - 85 85 - 95
Number of Cities 3 10 11 8 3
Find the mean literacy rate.

A survey conducted by a group of students on 20 families in a locality resulted in the following data regarding the number of members in different families:
Family size 1 - 3 3 – 5 5 – 7 7 – 9 9 - 11
Number of families 7 8 2 2 1
Find the mode of this data.
